Text: Re Tariff Curvces Project PlanNonPrivilegedpst Forwarded by Neil BresnanHOUEES on PM Charles Alvarez AM To Neil ES cc Subject Re Tariff Curvces Project Plan Sorry about that Neil Here is the project plan in excel format Charles Enron Energy Services From Neil Bresnan AM To Charles ES cc Subject Re Tariff Curvces Project Plan Help I cant open Eds email NFB Embedded StdOleLink Embedded StdOleLink

FERC Settlement Conference Re Refunds in the California MarketNonPrivilegedpst Is EPMI involved with the APX also They do not indicate a time line here but I assume they are talking about the end of last yearearly this year Let me know if we need to be more involved in this process NFB Forwarded by Neil BresnanHOUEES on AM Enron Energy Services From Dennis Benevides AM Phone No To Neil ES cc Subject FERC Settlement Conference Re Refunds in the California Market Forwarded by Dennis BenevidesHOUEES on AM Cristiana Gallegos on PM To Cristiana Gallegos cc Subject FERC Settlement Conference Re Refunds in the California Market APX is attaching a very important letter about the FERC settlement conference which concerns the California market This conference is addressing the issue of refunds by sellers of services to the California Independent System Operator and the California Power Exchange APX strongly encourages you to read this letter in order to protect your interests regarding these refund claims FERC APX Letter to Participants re Settlement Confdoc If you have any questions regarding this letter please contact your marketing representative FERC APX Letter to Participants re Settlement Confdoc

Deal TransferBooking Meeting TODAYNonPrivilegedpst Forwarded by Neil BresnanHOUEES on AM From Debra nronXgate on AM To Edith nronXgate Todd nronXgate Jeanette ES Ainsley ES Kenneth ES cc Neil ES Ofelia ES Subject Deal TransferBooking Meeting TODAY Neil Bresnan has scheduled the referenced meeting today for pm in conference room EB Please advise if your schedule conflicts with this time Thanks
Re FW Informational BrownBag Tuesday June th Mt HoodNonPrivilegedpst Issue number is of particular interest Lets get an opinion on this so we can forma a scheduling strategy NFB

Re Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Cc NonPrivilegedpst Maurice I have PRC Monday If we have the meeting with Pat at PM I should be able to make it Please send me an email to confirm the time and location NFB Michael Frazier PM To Maurice ES cc Neil ES Chris nronXgate Gregg ES James ES Subject Re Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Sounds like a feasible solution to me as long as we can get specified formats and the data uploads are wellmaintained by CSC Are there any extra costs on their end for performing this posting function mrf Maurice Winter AM To Neil ES Chris nronXgate Michael ES cc Gregg ES James ES Subject Load Forecasting access to MV interval data All I spoke with Pat Priestley this morning about our request to get access to the MV daily interval meter data for load forecasting She said that she would not be available to meet formally until Monday due to the declared disaster at their operations due to the flood She said they are moving back to the Pennzoil building today and Friday so things should be close to normal by Monday Pat said that it is not be a problem to export the MV data in just about any format on a daily basis for us The data is housed in MV databases which according to Pat can only be read by an MV system so we would need to purchase MV very expensive if we wanted to read the data directly I suggest we get the data exported daily from CSC to an FTP site at Enron because they can manage the process on a daily basis We can sweep the FTP site daily and have it automatically imported into our databases If we are in agreement with this solution I will create an emergency work request with CSC to begin working on this immediately Maurice Embedded StdOleLink

AS SPIN Cc NonPrivilegedpst We purchased MW of Spin from LADWP at LA for August Capacity payment energy strike We want to continue to offer the energy to the ISO at the price cap and to check the contingency flag yes so that we will only get called on in a contingency or emergency situation NFB

Ancillary ServicesNonPrivilegedpst FYG Forwarded by Neil BresnanHOUEES on PM From Bill Williams nronXgate on PM To Neil ES cc Subject Ancillary Services Neil The revenue for the sale that Phil entered to the CAISO will be captured by our volume management group RT will have no access to this revenue Consequently we will not buy or sell it on your behalf to capture it Please give me a call tomorrow for a more thorough explanation Thanks Bill

ASNonPrivilegedpst Forwarded by Neil BresnanHOUEES on AM Almeida Keoni on PM To Bresnan Neil cc Subject AS To answer your question about negative prices for AS there should be no negative price The ISO has identified specific days and hours in February where the prices for ancillary services are erroneous These erroneous prices are generated when the HA Requirement for a particular service is set to zero which has occurred due to SC overselfprovision of the ancillary service requirement in the DA Similarly the quantity should not be negative Even if there is over self provision the DA requirement which is ISOs need to procure AS should be zero instead of negative The DA requirement should be capped by a floor of zero Similarly the HA requirement cannot be negative The question about having a zero quantity with a price associated is related to the software calculations when folks are overselfproviding The procurement for operating reserves is of all load being served by Hydro and of all load being served by other Not plus of the total load For example T load L hydro L other so we take only of the L hydro and add that to of L other this will equal to the amount of the operating reserves we procure This can average out to Here are some questions and answers that you will find helpful Are self provided ancillary services on a SC required basis sequential excess spin rolls into nonspin requirement for the SC if offered as nonspin NO If an SC self provides MW of SPIN capacity yet the calculated market requirement is only MW the selfprovided amount of MW will be accepted for SPIN and none of the EXCESS MW of capacity considered for other AS services Please Note if in this example the SCs SPIN obligation is calculated to be MW the over self provided portion MW MW MW would receive a payment In this example there is an additional MW of EXCESS above the total market requirement that gets left on the table which will receive no compensation If self provision reserves are offered in excess of the total quantity required for the total market will the ISO take them all anyway or will the offerings be truncated and perhaps roll into a subsequent service if offered as self provide in that service NO As in the above answer The total Self provided quantity will be accepted and there would be no reduction of the preferred schedule even if this amount is ABOVE the total market requirement Also check out M and M at the following link thegridoperationsopsdocmarketops Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto

Ancillary Services Cc NonPrivilegedpst We are a go for our first test We are purchasing MW of Spinning capacity from LADWP for HEHE August They will deliver any energy called on to the ISO at LA Victorville Lugo We purchased the capacity for MWH and if the energy is called we pay LA understands and is willing to follow ISO instructions passed through our realtime desk with regards to ramping up and down within an hour Phil please submit our energy curve to the ISO at the cap for every hour Bill lets talk on Tuesday to discuss if our energy was called and if so how it went Thanks NFB
RE Ancillary Services Cc NonPrivilegedpst Thanks my question about the increments was directed to LADWP Are they giving us a Min call NFB

Ancillary ServicesNonPrivilegedpst Issues Non performance by counterpart dont deliver energy when called Penalty from ISO to ENA Loss of capacity payment credit back to the last date energy was called and delivered Credit offset with ISO for receivable when energy is called What is our daily debt to ISO associated with serving load other charge types What is our corporate debt to the ISO and who manages the offset How do we calculate anticipate what our debt will be foreword looking What is our recourse if the Offer cap is changed within the day What is the minimum increment that the counterpart will sell power if called min hour What are losses associated with the delivery point Do we gross up our purchase or pay the inc price to the ISO Is there any congestion associated with the realtime call on energy Is there any congestion associated with Day Ahead Capacity ANY OTHER ISSUES NFB

FW July AS DataNonPrivilegedpst Forwarded by Neil BresnanHOUEES on AM From Stewart nronXgate on PM To Neil ES cc Subject FW July AS Data Original Message From Heizenrader Tim Sent Tuesday July PM To Rosman Stewart Subject July AS Data Stewart Is this the table that youre looking for Tim

Re FW BandNonPrivilegedpst and possibly early deals have no consumption band band calculated annual calculation and settlement monthly calculation annual settlement I dont know where the current contracts stand ask Todd Im shocked that you dont want to talk to John about the deals based on production of milk or ice NFB From Chris nronXgate on AM To Neil ES cc Subject FW Band Original Message From Richter Jeff Sent Wednesday August PM To Stokley Chris Subject FW Band Original Message From Bresnan Neil Sent Wednesday August PM To Richter Jeff Subject Band Chris This is Richter Neil had reviews to do so I finished up with the email Hope this helps Let me know if you need anything else Richter Several deals have no band see note from Dennis The issue with the bands is how to price them On the surface the band is the same as selling the customer a call and a put in actual fact the customer is not going to always exercise the option on a purely economic basis Building managers need to keep the lights on even when it is hot Most of our contracts contemplate the establishment of a baseline during the first year of the contract Most of our consumption bands are settled on an annual basis giving the client a huge swing on an intramonth basis New clients have consumption bands which are calculated on a monthly basis and settled with the customer on an annual basis We dont currently manage the position aggressively Intramonth we forecast load for clients and assume all the load is physical when in fact after a customer goes over or under the band we should be buy index for the over under Chris Richter takes over deals most deals in have a consumption band which gets settled annually deals as of feb consumption bands with monthly settlements New deals See Neils notes above One thing to remember is that the customer is exposed to hourly index price and grid charges on every kw they use outside the band and we owe them if they underconsume this needs to be flashed and then actualized when the data is available One note is that all the existing contracts up to EWS taking over have this little flaw the customer is exposed to the hourly price and we wear the risk of all the grid charges Not good

Re Consumption BandsNonPrivilegedpst Forwarded by Neil BresnanHOUEES on PM Enron Energy Services From Dennis Benevides PM Phone No To Neil ES cc Subject Re Consumption Bands The attached presentations have some info which may help Regarding bands in CA PacBell and UCCSU have no band All other commodity only transactions have band on annual basis with the exception of recently executed deals monthly band and old deals ran which were associated with the national outsource transactions which had customized volumetric structures in some cases no band which were executed and priced by the old consumption desk Dennis Enron Energy Services From Neil Bresnan PM To Dennis ES cc Subject Consumption Bands We have to do a presentation for Sr Management on the consumption bands and appreciate it is you could offer a little help Do you recall off hand any specific contracts that currently have no consumption band or have an annual consumption band Thanks NFB Embedded StdOleLink

Re EES AND EPMI check out for July Cc NonPrivilegedpst I show the same for COB Mid C and PV Let me know what you have for NP and SP Thanks From Cara nronXgate on AM To Neil ES cc Jeff nronXgate Subject EES AND EPMI check out for July I will send you a sheet today around noon my time The brief overview is that we are flat at COB and Mid C At PV you have a postition with me you owe me on HLH you owe me on LLH Original Message From Bresnan Neil Sent Monday June PM To Semperger Cara Subject Monthly check out Cara Would you help me check out our positions with EMPI for July MidC COB NP SP PV With all the moving parts we have now I want to start early Let me kow if you have any questions Thanks

NonPrivilegedpst Lets make sure an estimate makes its way into our models When a reserve deficiency period ends and generation operating reserves rise to a nonreserve deficiency period the maximum price that can be charged for spot market sales in California and the rest of the WSCC during the nonreserve deficiency period absent cost justification will be of the highest hourly price that was in effect during the most recent Stage reserve deficiency period called by the California ISO An uplift charge for fuel used for start up of generators will not be included in the market clearing price but instead will be recovered through ISO charges to all California load on the ISOs transmission system NFB

Followup on Southland True upNonPrivilegedpst We need some immediate resolution on this one it is about to blow up NFB Forwarded by Neil BresnanHOUEES on AM Ress Young AM To Neil ES cc Subject Followup on Southland True up Forwarded by Ress YoungHOUEES on AM Lamar Frazier PM To Diann ES Ress ES cc Subject Followup on Southland True up Diann What is the status of the check for this true up I spoke to Cheryl and she wants to pay in one lump sum as opposed to the two seperate checks I have a call into the Controller to discuss delaying the payment until July for Q end purposes So let me know where we are on generating a check for these guys Thanks Ress Where are we with the January trueup I need to give Southland an idea of when we think those revised settlements will be finalized Thanks Lamar Forwarded by Lamar FrazierHOUEES on PM Herman Edward on PM To Wills Irene cc Subject Followup Hi Lamar Just following up on our conversation a couple of days ago Any additional information regarding when I should expect to see the check By the way why dont you send it to my attention Eleven Inc N Haskell Dallas Tx Attention Ed Herman Legal Department I will make sure it gets to the right folks Also any guess as to when we will know the resolution of the January bill ie when the outside agency will make the rate determination Please keep me posted I appreciate your help in this matter Thanks Ed

Malcolm ES Kevin ES cc SubjectProposed DA Decision at CPUC TresurerDept of Finance Says No Delay Past June Drafts out by Friday Sue Mara Enron Corp Tel Fax Forwarded by Susan J MaraNAEnron on PM Counihan Rick PM To ARM List Serve Plotkin Norm nplotk Pahos Theo cc Allen Stevan st Fairchild Tracy Douglass Dan Subject News on DA Decisio n at CPUC Ann Watson of Comm Bilas office said that the decision ending DA and the Bilas alternate would be mailed outtoday but probably not up on the websit e until tomorrow Everyone should watch their mail and email for it Ann confirmed that Hertzberg had called Lynch asking for them to delay And of course the PUC accommodated them today Ann said however that she was not able to hold the decision until July The reason is that a letter from the Treasurer DWR and Finance was sent to Commissioners and legislators telling them that DA had to be suspended by June in order fo r appeals etc to be settled by the time the issue the bonds in August I believe someone else referenced this letter in an email yesterday Ann is appending the letter to the Bilas alternate so everyone can see it and comment Also they are going to ask for comments on going to bottoms up rates Rick Counihan Green Mountain
